intro: Oldenlandia abyssinica, commonly known as the "Abyssinian mosquito plant," is a flowering plant native to Africa, particularly Ethiopia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white flowers and hairy, oval-shaped leaves. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. It has small, yellowish fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. The species is also noted for its medicinal properties, used in traditional medicine for various health purposes.
